metadata.Title: CVE-2017-2825 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - high
metadata.Description:
In the trapper functionality of Zabbix Server 2.4.x, specifically craftedtrapper packets can pass database logic checks, resulting in databasewrites. An attacker can set up a Man-in-the-Middle server to alter trapperrequests made between an active Zabbix proxy and Server to trigger thisvulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-2825` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

zabbix-agent - 1:3.0.7+dfsg-3
zabbix-frontend-php - 1:3.0.7+dfsg-3
zabbix-java-gateway - 1:3.0.7+dfsg-3
zabbix-proxy-mysql - 1:3.0.7+dfsg-3
zabbix-proxy-pgsql - 1:3.0.7+dfsg-3
zabbix-proxy-sqlite3 - 1:3.0.7+dfsg-3
zabbix-server-mysql - 1:3.0.7+dfsg-3
zabbix-server-pgsql - 1:3.0.7+dfsg-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: zabbix package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:3.0.7+dfsg-3').
